headline: Ohio high court hears lawsuit over company’s COVID losses
author: Associated Press
sentences:
By ANDREW WELSH-HUGGINS
COLUMBUS — An Ohio business says its insurance company must compensate it for financial losses suffered during a pandemic-related shutdown.
At issue before the court is a policy purchased by Neuro-Communication Services Inc., a northeastern Ohio audiology company, from the Cinci ...
The insurance company refused to pay, saying its policy didn’t cover such losses.
